unnormalised: Telecommunications: Data Plan Competition Heats Up
normalised: Telecommunications: Data Plan Competition Heats Up

unnormalised: Mumbai, India – The Indian telecommunications sector is witnessing renewed competition in data plans, with major players vying for market share. Jio announced revisions to its existing plans yesterday, offering up to 20% more data at existing price points.
normalised: Mumbai, India – The Indian telecommunications sector is witnessing renewed competition in data plans, with major players vying for market share. J I O announced revisions to its existing plans yesterday, offering up to twenty percent more data at existing price points.

unnormalised: Airtel quickly responded, unveiling new "Family Plans" targeted at households in Tier 2 cities like Lucknow and Kanpur. These plans offer bundled data and voice benefits for multiple users, starting at Rs. 499 per month for a family of four.
normalised: Airtel quickly responded, unveiling new "Family Plans" targeted at households in Tier two cities like Lucknow and Kanpur. These plans offer bundled data and voice benefits for multiple users, starting at rupee four hundred and ninety nine per month for a family of four.

unnormalised: Dr. Sanjay Verma, a telecom analyst at IIT Delhi, noted that this price war is beneficial for consumers. "Increased data consumption is vital for India's digital economy," he stated. However, concerns remain regarding the impact on smaller players struggling to compete with the larger firms.
normalised: Doctor Sanjay Verma, a telecom analyst at I I T Delhi, noted that this price war is beneficial for consumers. "Increased data consumption is vital for India's digital economy," he stated. However, concerns remain regarding the impact on smaller players struggling to compete with the larger firms.

unnormalised: Vodafone Idea (Vi) is expected to announce its counter-strategy next week. Experts predict Vi will focus on targeted regional offerings and enhanced customer service. Meanwhile, the rollout of 5G services across major metropolitan areas is progressing, with over 50,000 sq ft of coverage expected in Bangalore by year-end.
normalised: Vodafone Idea (V I) is expected to announce its counter-strategy next week. Experts predict V I will focus on targeted regional offerings and enhanced customer service. Meanwhile, the rollout of five G services across major metropolitan areas is progressing, with over fifty thousand square feet of coverage expected in Bangalore by year-end.
